meanings.definition: To reach or go beyond in sailing.
meanings.sent1: The ship forereached the distant shore with ease.
meanings.sent2: The sailboat forereached the buoy in record time.
meanings.sent3: The little boat forereached the big ship, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her determination forereached any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The wind helped the boat forereach its destination swiftly.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outstrip in progress or achievement.
meanings.sent1: He forereached his own expectations by acing the test.
meanings.sent2: The team forereached their previous best performance.
meanings.sent3: The student forereached the teacher's knowledge on the subject.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication forereached any doubts about her abilities.
meanings.sent5: Their innovation forereached all competitors in the market.
